intro: Deppea amaranthoides, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Deppea amaranthoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and flowers.
